result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fernando Mendez Gomez

records.addlTxt: Notice of Bail Bond Forfeiture and Hearing. Bond set 10-19-2022.

2:19 PM case called. Defendant Fernando Mendez Gomez not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter St John previously sworn. Warrant to issue, bond forfeited. Minutes filed.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

BOND TO COVER 22GF1073 & 21CT576

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH G.C.R.S. dob 7-28-1992 or RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Called at1:21 PM. Defendant Fernando Mendez Gomez in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared for bond purposes only. Interpreter Sarah St John appeared with defendant. Discussion as to bond. Total Bond set at $1000 cash. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
